TextBody:
Hi Tanushree,

Thank you for your time today!
After checking I found out the following details about the recovery folder:

	Recovery Folder Retention Period (days) – this setting is speciﬁc for Mac and Linux computers. It acts as a quarantine folder before a transferred ﬁle has been fully inspected for content, avoiding any potential ﬁle loss due to blocked transfers. After the speciﬁed time interval, the ﬁles are permanently deleted.


      • Devices Recovery Folder Max Size (MB) – this setting is speciﬁc for Mac and Linux computers. Maximum size for the quarantine folder. If the value is reached, new ﬁles will overwrite the oldest ones.

Its location on Macs is /Users/Shared/EPP/RecoveredFiles.

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

Hi Tanushree,

Thank you for your time today!
After checking I found out the following details about the recovery folder:

  *   Recovery Folder Retention Period (days) – this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. It acts as a quarantine folder before a transferred ?le has been fully inspected for content, avoiding any potential ?le loss due to blocked transfers. After the speci?ed time interval, the ?les are permanently deleted.

      • Devices Recovery Folder Max Size (MB) – this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. Maximum size for the quarantine folder. If the value is reached, new ?les will overwrite the oldest ones.

Its location on Macs is /Users/Shared/EPP/RecoveredFiles.

Hi Tanushree,

Thank you for your time today!
After checking I found out the following details about the recovery folder:

  *   Recovery Folder Retention Period (days) – this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. It acts as a quarantine folder before a transferred ?le has been fully inspected for content, avoiding any potential ?le loss due to blocked transfers. After the speci?ed time interval, the ?les are permanently deleted.

      • Devices Recovery Folder Max Size (MB) – this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. Maximum size for the quarantine folder. If the value is reached, new ?les will overwrite the oldest ones.

Its location on Macs is /Users/Shared/EPP/RecoveredFiles.

sophospsmartbannerend 
Hi Tanushree,

Thank you for your time today!
After checking I found out the following details about the recovery folder:

	Recovery Folder Retention Period (days) – this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. It acts as a quarantine folder before a transferred ?le has been fully inspected for content, avoiding any potential ?le loss due to blocked transfers. After the speci?ed time interval, the ?les are permanently deleted.


      • Devices Recovery Folder Max Size (MB) – this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. Maximum size for the quarantine folder. If the value is reached, new ?les will overwrite the oldest ones.

Its location on Macs is /Users/Shared/EPP/RecoveredFiles.

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer

Hi Tanushree,

Thank you for your time today!
After checking I found out the following details about the recovery folder:

 *   Recovery Folder Retention Period (days) - this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. It acts as a quarantine folder before a transferred ?le has been fully inspected for content, avoiding any potential ?le loss due to blocked transfers. After the speci?ed time interval, the ?les are permanently deleted.

      * Devices Recovery Folder Max Size (MB) - this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. Maximum size for the quarantine folder. If the value is reached, new ?les will overwrite the oldest ones.

Its location on Macs is /Users/Shared/EPP/RecoveredFiles.

Best regards,

Hi Tanushree,

Thank you for your time today!
After checking I found out the following details about the recovery folder:

 *   Recovery Folder Retention Period (days) - this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. It acts as a quarantine folder before a transferred ?le has been fully inspected for content, avoiding any potential ?le loss due to blocked transfers. After the speci?ed time interval, the ?les are permanently deleted.

      * Devices Recovery Folder Max Size (MB) - this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. Maximum size for the quarantine folder. If the value is reached, new ?les will overwrite the oldest ones.

Its location on Macs is /Users/Shared/EPP/RecoveredFiles.

Hi Tanushree,

Thank you for your time today!
After checking I found out the following details about the recovery folder:


	Recovery Folder Retention Period (days) – this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. It acts as a quarantine folder before a transferred ?le has been fully inspected for content, avoiding any potential ?le loss due to blocked transfers. After the speci?ed time interval, the ?les are permanently deleted.


      • Devices Recovery Folder Max Size (MB) – this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. Maximum size for the quarantine folder. If the value is reached, new ?les will overwrite the oldest ones.

Its location on Macs is /Users/Shared/EPP/RecoveredFiles.


Best regards,

Hi Tanushree,

Thank you for your time today!
After checking I found out the following details about the recovery folder:


	Recovery Folder Retention Period (days) – this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. It acts as a quarantine folder before a transferred ?le has been fully inspected for content, avoiding any potential ?le loss due to blocked transfers. After the speci?ed time interval, the ?les are permanently deleted.


      • Devices Recovery Folder Max Size (MB) – this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. Maximum size for the quarantine folder. If the value is reached, new ?les will overwrite the oldest ones.

Its location on Macs is /Users/Shared/EPP/RecoveredFiles.

Hi Tanushree,

Thank you for your time today!
After checking I found out the following details about the recovery folder:

  *   Recovery Folder Retention Period (days) – this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. It acts as a quarantine folder before a transferred ?le has been fully inspected for content, avoiding any potential ?le loss due to blocked transfers. After the speci?ed time interval, the ?les are permanently deleted.

      • Devices Recovery Folder Max Size (MB) – this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. Maximum size for the quarantine folder. If the value is reached, new ?les will overwrite the oldest ones.

Its location on Macs is /Users/Shared/EPP/RecoveredFiles.

Hi Tanushree,

Thank you for your time today!
After checking I found out the following details about the recovery folder:


	Recovery Folder Retention Period (days) – this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. It acts as a quarantine folder before a transferred ?le has been fully inspected for content, avoiding any potential ?le loss due to blocked transfers. After the speci?ed time interval, the ?les are permanently deleted.


      • Devices Recovery Folder Max Size (MB) – this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. Maximum size for the quarantine folder. If the value is reached, new ?les will overwrite the oldest ones.

Its location on Macs is /Users/Shared/EPP/RecoveredFiles.


Best regards,

Hi Tanushree,

Thank you for your time today!
After checking I found out the following details about the recovery folder:

  *   Recovery Folder Retention Period (days) – this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. It acts as a quarantine folder before a transferred ?le has been fully inspected for content, avoiding any potential ?le loss due to blocked transfers. After the speci?ed time interval, the ?les are permanently deleted.

      • Devices Recovery Folder Max Size (MB) – this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. Maximum size for the quarantine folder. If the value is reached, new ?les will overwrite the oldest ones.

Its location on Macs is /Users/Shared/EPP/RecoveredFiles.

Hi Tanushree,

Thank you for your time today!
After checking I found out the following details about the recovery folder:

 *   Recovery Folder Retention Period (days) - this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. It acts as a quarantine folder before a transferred ?le has been fully inspected for content, avoiding any potential ?le loss due to blocked transfers. After the speci?ed time interval, the ?les are permanently deleted.

      * Devices Recovery Folder Max Size (MB) - this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. Maximum size for the quarantine folder. If the value is reached, new ?les will overwrite the oldest ones.

Its location on Macs is /Users/Shared/EPP/RecoveredFiles.

Hi Tanushree,

Thank you for your time today!
After checking I found out the following details about the recovery folder:

  *   Recovery Folder Retention Period (days) – this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. It acts as a quarantine folder before a transferred ?le has been fully inspected for content, avoiding any potential ?le loss due to blocked transfers. After the speci?ed time interval, the ?les are permanently deleted.

      • Devices Recovery Folder Max Size (MB) – this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. Maximum size for the quarantine folder. If the value is reached, new ?les will overwrite the oldest ones.

Its location on Macs is /Users/Shared/EPP/RecoveredFiles.

Hi Tanushree,

Thank you for your time today!
After checking I found out the following details about the recovery folder:

  *   Recovery Folder Retention Period (days) - this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. It acts as a quarantine folder before a transferred ?le has been fully inspected for content, avoiding any potential ?le loss due to blocked transfers. After the speci?ed time interval, the ?les are permanently deleted.

      * Devices Recovery Folder Max Size (MB) - this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. Maximum size for the quarantine folder. If the value is reached, new ?les will overwrite the oldest ones.

Its location on Macs is /Users/Shared/EPP/RecoveredFiles.

Hi Tanushree,

Thank you for your time today!
After checking I found out the following details about the recovery folder:


	Recovery Folder Retention Period (days) – this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. It acts as a quarantine folder before a transferred ?le has been fully inspected for content, avoiding any potential ?le loss due to blocked transfers. After the speci?ed time interval, the ?les are permanently deleted.


      • Devices Recovery Folder Max Size (MB) – this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. Maximum size for the quarantine folder. If the value is reached, new ?les will overwrite the oldest ones.

Its location on Macs is /Users/Shared/EPP/RecoveredFiles.


Best regards,

Hi Tanushree,

Thank you for your time today!
After checking I found out the following details about the recovery folder:

  *   Recovery Folder Retention Period (days) – this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. It acts as a quarantine folder before a transferred ?le has been fully inspected for content, avoiding any potential ?le loss due to blocked transfers. After the speci?ed time interval, the ?les are permanently deleted.

      • Devices Recovery Folder Max Size (MB) – this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. Maximum size for the quarantine folder. If the value is reached, new ?les will overwrite the oldest ones.

Its location on Macs is /Users/Shared/EPP/RecoveredFiles.

Hi Tanushree,

Thank you for your time today!
After checking I found out the following details about the recovery folder:


	Recovery Folder Retention Period (days) – this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. It acts as a quarantine folder before a transferred ?le has been fully inspected for content, avoiding any potential ?le loss due to blocked transfers. After the speci?ed time interval, the ?les are permanently deleted.


      • Devices Recovery Folder Max Size (MB) – this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. Maximum size for the quarantine folder. If the value is reached, new ?les will overwrite the oldest ones.

Its location on Macs is /Users/Shared/EPP/RecoveredFiles.


Best regards,

Hi Tanushree,

Thank you for your time today!
After checking I found out the following details about the recovery folder:


	Recovery Folder Retention Period (days) – this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. It acts as a quarantine folder before a transferred ?le has been fully inspected for content, avoiding any potential ?le loss due to blocked transfers. After the speci?ed time interval, the ?les are permanently deleted.


      • Devices Recovery Folder Max Size (MB) – this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. Maximum size for the quarantine folder. If the value is reached, new ?les will overwrite the oldest ones.

Its location on Macs is /Users/Shared/EPP/RecoveredFiles.

Hi Tanushree,

Thank you for your time today!
After checking I found out the following details about the recovery folder:

 *   Recovery Folder Retention Period (days) - this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. It acts as a quarantine folder before a transferred ?le has been fully inspected for content, avoiding any potential ?le loss due to blocked transfers. After the speci?ed time interval, the ?les are permanently deleted.

      * Devices Recovery Folder Max Size (MB) - this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. Maximum size for the quarantine folder. If the value is reached, new ?les will overwrite the oldest ones.

Its location on Macs is /Users/Shared/EPP/RecoveredFiles.

Hi Tanushree,

Thank you for your time today!
After checking I found out the following details about the recovery folder:

  *   Recovery Folder Retention Period (days) – this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. It acts as a quarantine folder before a transferred ?le has been fully inspected for content, avoiding any potential ?le loss due to blocked transfers. After the speci?ed time interval, the ?les are permanently deleted.

      • Devices Recovery Folder Max Size (MB) – this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. Maximum size for the quarantine folder. If the value is reached, new ?les will overwrite the oldest ones.

Its location on Macs is /Users/Shared/EPP/RecoveredFiles.

Hi Tanushree,

Thank you for your time today!
After checking I found out the following details about the recovery folder:

 *   Recovery Folder Retention Period (days) – this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. It acts as a quarantine folder before a transferred ?le has been fully inspected for content, avoiding any potential ?le loss due to blocked transfers. After the speci?ed time interval, the ?les are permanently deleted.

      • Devices Recovery Folder Max Size (MB) – this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. Maximum size for the quarantine folder. If the value is reached, new ?les will overwrite the oldest ones.

Its location on Macs is /Users/Shared/EPP/RecoveredFiles.

Hi Tanushree,

Thank you for your time today!
After checking I found out the following details about the recovery folder:

  *   Recovery Folder Retention Period (days) – this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. It acts as a quarantine folder before a transferred ?le has been fully inspected for content, avoiding any potential ?le loss due to blocked transfers. After the speci?ed time interval, the ?les are permanently deleted.

      • Devices Recovery Folder Max Size (MB) – this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. Maximum size for the quarantine folder. If the value is reached, new ?les will overwrite the oldest ones.

Its location on Macs is /Users/Shared/EPP/RecoveredFiles.

Hi Tanushree,

Thank you for your time today!
After checking I found out the following details about the recovery folder:

 *   Recovery Folder Retention Period (days) – this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. It acts as a quarantine folder before a transferred ?le has been fully inspected for content, avoiding any potential ?le loss due to blocked transfers. After the speci?ed time interval, the ?les are permanently deleted.

      • Devices Recovery Folder Max Size (MB) – this setting is speci?c for Mac and Linux computers. Maximum size for the quarantine folder. If the value is reached, new ?les will overwrite the oldest ones.

Its location on Macs is /Users/Shared/EPP/RecoveredFiles.
